pli-tv-kd21:0.3.eng: The chapter on the group of five hundred

pli-tv-kd21:0.4.eng: 1. The origin story of the communal recitation

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.1.eng: Then Venerable Mahākassapa addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.1.comm: The unusual opening to this Chapter suggests that this section has at some point been part of another longer text, most likely DN 16, the Mahāparinibbāna Sutta, with which it dovetails. See Erich Frauwallner, “The Earliest Vinaya and the Beginnings of Buddhist Literature”, pp. 41–46.

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.2.pli: “ekamidāhaṃ, āvuso, samayaṃ pāvāya kusināraṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.2.eng: “On one occasion, as I was traveling from Pāvā to Kusināra with a large sangha of five hundred monks,

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.3.pli: Atha khvāhaṃ, āvuso, maggā okkamma aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdiṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.3.eng: I left the road and sat down at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro ājīvako kusinārāya mandāravapupphaṃ gahetvā pāvaṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.4.eng: Just then a follower of the Ājīvakas was traveling toward Pāvā on the same road, holding a coral-tree flower that he had picked up in Kusināra.

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.5.pli: Addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, taṃ ājīvakaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.7.eng: ‘Do you know anything about our Teacher?’

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.9.eng: Today it’s seven days since the ascetic Gotama attained final extinguishment.

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.10.eng: That’s why I carry this coral-tree flower.’

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.11.pli: Tatrāvuso, ye te bhikkhū avītarāgā appekacce bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṃ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti—
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.11.eng: Some of the monks there who were not yet free from desire threw up their arms and cried, collapsed on the ground, and rolled back and forth, lamenting,

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.12.pli: atikhippaṃ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṃ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṃ cakkhuṃ loke antarahitanti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.12.eng: ‘The Buddha, the Happy One, has attained final extinguishment too soon—too soon has the eye of the world been put out!’

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.13.pli: Ye pana te bhikkhū vītarāgā te satā sampajānā adhivāsenti—
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.13.eng: But the monks there who were free from desire bore it with mindfulness and full awareness, saying,

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.14.eng: ‘All phenomena are impermanent. How could it be any different?’

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.15.pli: Atha khvāhaṃ, āvuso, te bhikkhū etadavocaṃ—

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.19.pli: sabbeheva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.19.eng: that we must be separated from everyone and everything dear and agreeable to us?

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.20.pli: Taṃ kutettha āvuso labbhā, yaṃ taṃ jātaṃ bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ palokadhammaṃ, taṃ vata mā palujjīti—
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.20.eng: How could that which is born, become, made up, and of a nature to fall apart, not fall apart?

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.22.pli: Tena kho panāvuso, samayena subhaddo nāma vuḍḍhapabbajito tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.22.eng: On that occasion a monk called Subhadda, who had gone forth when old, was part of that group.

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.23.pli: Atha kho, āvuso, subhaddo vuḍḍhapabbajito te bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.26.eng: It’s good that we are free from that great ascetic.

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.28.pli: idaṃ vo kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatīti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.28.eng: always being told what’s allowable and what’s not.

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.29.pli: Idāni pana mayaṃ yaṃ icchissāma taṃ karissāma, yaṃ na icchissāma na taṃ karissāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.29.eng: Now we can do what we like and not do what we don’t like.’

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.30.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyāma.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.30.eng: So then, let’s recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law—

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.31.eng: before what’s contrary to the Teaching shines forth and the Teaching is obstructed;

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.32.eng: before what’s contrary to the Monastic Law shines forth and the Monastic Law is obstructed;

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.33.pli: pure adhammavādino balavanto honti, dhammavādino dubbalā honti;
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.33.eng: before those who speak contrary to the Teaching become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak;

pli-tv-kd21:1.1.34.pli: pure avinayavādino balavanto honti, vinayavādino dubbalā hontī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.1.34.eng: before those who speak contrary to the Monastic Law become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.2.1.eng: “Well then, venerable, please select the monks.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.2.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo ekenūnapañcaarahantasatāni uccini.
pli-tv-kd21:1.2.2.eng: Mahākassapa then selected four hundred and ninety-nine perfected ones.

pli-tv-kd21:1.2.4.pli: “ayaṃ, bhante, āyasmā ānando kiñcāpi sekkho, abhabbo chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatiṃ gantuṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.2.4.eng: “There’s Venerable Ānanda who, although still a trainee, is incapable of acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, or fear.

pli-tv-kd21:1.2.5.pli: Bahu ca anena bhagavato santike dhammo ca vinayo ca pariyatto.
pli-tv-kd21:1.2.5.eng: He has learned many teachings and much Monastic Law from the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd21:1.2.6.pli: Tena hi, bhante, thero āyasmantampi ānandaṃ uccinatū”ti.

pli-tv-kd21:1.2.7.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantampi ānandaṃ uccini.

pli-tv-kd21:1.3.2.pli: “kattha nu kho mayaṃ dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyeyyāmā”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.3.2.eng: “Where should we recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.3.4.pli: “rājagahaṃ kho mahāgocaraṃ pahūtasenāsanaṃ, yannūna mayaṃ rājagahe vassaṃ vasantā dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyeyyāma.
pli-tv-kd21:1.3.4.eng: “Rājagaha has much almsfood and many dwellings. Let’s spend the rainy season there in order to recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd21:1.3.5.pli: Na aññe bhikkhū rājagahe vassaṃ upagaccheyyun”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.3.5.eng: No other monks should enter the rainy-season residence at Rājagaha.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo saṅghaṃ ñāpesi—
pli-tv-kd21:1.4.1.eng: And Venerable Mahākassapa informed the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.2.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.3.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imāni pañca bhikkhusatāni sammanneyya—
pli-tv-kd21:1.4.3.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint these five hundred monks

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.4.pli: rājagahe vassaṃ vasantāni dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ, na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassaṃ vasitabbanti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.4.4.eng: to spend the rainy season at Rājagaha in order to recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law. No other monks should enter the rainy-season residence at Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.6.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.7.eng: The Sangha appoints these five hundred monks

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.8.pli: rājagahe vassaṃ vasantāni dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ, na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassaṃ vasitabbanti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.4.8.eng: to spend the rainy season at Rājagaha in order to recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law. No other monks should spend the rainy-season residence at Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.9.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati imesaṃ pañcannaṃ bhikkhusatānaṃ sammuti—
pli-tv-kd21:1.4.9.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing these five hundred monks

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.10.pli: rājagahe vassaṃ vasantānaṃ dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ, na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassaṃ vasitabbanti—
pli-tv-kd21:1.4.10.eng: to spend the rainy season at Rājagaha in order to recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law, with no other monks spending the rainy-season residence at Rājagaha,

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.12.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.13.pli: Sammatāni saṅghena imāni pañca bhikkhusatāni rājagahe vassaṃ vasantāni dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ, na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassaṃ vasitabbanti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.4.13.eng: The Sangha has appointed these five hundred monks to spend the rainy season at Rājagaha in order to recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law. No other monks should enter the rainy-season residence at Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd21:1.4.14.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.4.14.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.5.1.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū rājagahaṃ agamaṃsu dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.5.1.eng: The senior monks then went to Rājagaha to recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd21:1.5.3.eng: “The Buddha has praised repairing what’s defective and broken.

pli-tv-kd21:1.5.4.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, paṭhamaṃ māsaṃ khaṇḍaphullaṃ paṭisaṅkharoma;
pli-tv-kd21:1.5.4.eng: Well then, let’s spend the first month doing repairs,

pli-tv-kd21:1.5.5.pli: majjhimaṃ māsaṃ sannipatitvā dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.5.5.eng: and then gather for the middle month to recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.5.6.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū paṭhamaṃ māsaṃ khaṇḍaphullaṃ paṭisaṅkhariṃsu.
pli-tv-kd21:1.5.6.eng: They then spent the first month doing repairs.

pli-tv-kd21:1.6.2.pli: “sve sannipāto na kho metaṃ patirūpaṃ, yohaṃ sekkho samāno sannipātaṃ gaccheyyan”ti—
pli-tv-kd21:1.6.2.eng: “It wouldn’t be proper for me to go to the assembly tomorrow if I’m still a trainee.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.6.3.pli: bahudeva rattiṃ kāyagatāya satiyā vītināmetvā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ “nipajjissāmī”ti kāyaṃ āvajjesi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.6.3.eng: After spending most of the night with mindfulness directed to the body, early in the morning he bent over to lie down.

pli-tv-kd21:1.6.4.pli: Appattañca sīsaṃ bibbohanaṃ, bhūmito ca pādā muttā.
pli-tv-kd21:1.6.4.eng: In the interval between his feet coming off the ground and his head hitting the pillow,

pli-tv-kd21:1.6.5.pli: Etasmiṃ antare anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimucci.
pli-tv-kd21:1.6.5.eng: his mind was freed from the corruptions through letting go.

pli-tv-kd21:1.6.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando arahā samāno sannipātaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.6.6.eng: And Venerable Ānanda went to the assembly as a perfected one.

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo saṅghaṃ ñāpesi—
pli-tv-kd21:1.7.1.eng: Venerable Mahākassapa then informed the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.2.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.3.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ upāliṃ vinayaṃ puccheyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.7.3.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will ask Upāli about the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.5.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.6.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ āyasmatā mahākassapena vinayaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.7.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will reply when asked by Venerable Mahākassapa about the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.7.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ upāliṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.8.eng: “Where was the first offense entailing expulsion laid down?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ upāliṃ paṭhamassa pārājikassa vatthumpi pucchi, nidānampi pucchi, puggalampi pucchi, paññattimpi pucchi, anupaññattimpi pucchi, āpattimpi pucchi, anāpattimpi pucchi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.7.14.eng: Mahākassapa also asked Upāli about the topic of the first offense entailing expulsion, about the origin story, about the person, about the rule, about the additions to the rule, about the offense, and about the non-offenses.

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.15.eng: “And where was the second offense entailing expulsion laid down?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.21.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ upāliṃ dutiyassa pārājikassa vatthumpi pucchi, nidānampi pucchi, puggalampi pucchi, paññattimpi pucchi, anupaññattimpi pucchi, āpattimpi pucchi, anāpattimpi pucchi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.7.21.eng: Mahākassapa also asked Upāli about the topic of the second offense entailing expulsion, about the origin story, about the person, about the rule, about the additions to the rule, about the offense, and about the non-offenses.

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.22.eng: “And where was the third offense entailing expulsion laid down?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.28.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ upāliṃ tatiyassa pārājikassa vatthumpi pucchi, nidānampi pucchi, puggalampi pucchi, paññattimpi pucchi, anupaññattimpi pucchi, āpattimpi pucchi, anāpattimpi pucchi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.7.28.eng: Mahākassapa also asked Upāli about the topic of the third offense entailing expulsion, about the origin story, about the person, about the rule, about the additions to the rule, about the offense, and about the non-offenses.

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.29.eng: “And where was the fourth offense entailing expulsion laid down?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.32.eng: “The monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.35.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ upāliṃ catutthassa pārājikassa vatthumpi pucchi, nidānampi pucchi, puggalampi pucchi, paññattimpi pucchi, anupaññattimpi pucchi, āpattimpi pucchi, anāpattimpi pucchi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.7.35.eng: Mahākassapa also asked Upāli about the topic of the fourth offense entailing expulsion, about the origin story, about the person, about the rule, about the additions to the rule, about the offense, and about the non-offenses.

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.36.eng: In this way he asked about the analyses of both Monastic Codes.

pli-tv-kd21:1.7.37.eng: Upāli was able to reply to each and every question.

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo saṅghaṃ ñāpesi—
pli-tv-kd21:1.8.1.eng: Venerable Mahākassapa then informed the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.2.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.3.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ ānandaṃ dhammaṃ puccheyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.8.3.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will ask Ānanda about the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.5.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.6.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ āyasmatā mahākassapena dhammaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.8.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will reply when asked by Venerable Mahākassapa about the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.7.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.8.comm: This is the first discourse of the Dīgha Nikāya, the Brahmajāla Sutta, DN 1:1.1.1.

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.9.pli: “Antarā ca, bhante, rājagahaṃ antarā ca nāḷandaṃ rājāgārake ambalaṭṭhikāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.8.9.eng: “At the royal rest-house at Ambalaṭṭhikā, between Rājagaha and Nāḷanda.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.11.eng: “The wanderer Suppiya and the young brahmin Brahmadatta.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.12.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ brahmajālassa nidānampi pucchi, puggalampi pucchi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.8.12.eng: Mahākassapa also asked Ānanda about the origin story of ‘The Supreme Net’ and about the person.

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.13.eng: “Where was ‘The Fruits of the Monastic Life’ spoken?”
pli-tv-kd21:1.8.13.comm: This is the second discourse of the Dīgha Nikāya, the Sāmaññaphala Sutta, DN 2:1.1.1.

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.17.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ sāmaññaphalassa nidānampi pucchi, puggalampi pucchi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.8.17.eng: Mahākassapa also asked Ānanda about the origin story of ‘The Fruits of the Monastic Life’ and about the person.

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.18.eng: In this way he asked about the five collections.

pli-tv-kd21:1.8.19.eng: Ānanda was able to reply to each and every question.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.0.eng: 2. Discussion of the minor training rules

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando there bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.1.eng: Ānanda said to the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.2.eng: “At the time of his final extinguishment, the Buddha said to me,

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.3.pli: ‘ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, saṅgho mamaccayena khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadāni samūhaneyyā’”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.3.eng: ‘After my passing away, Ānanda, if the Sangha wishes, it may abolish the minor training rules.’”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.4.eng: “But, Ānanda, did you ask the Buddha

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.5.eng: what the minor training rules are?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.9.eng: “Apart from the four rules entailing expulsion, the rest are the minor training rules.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.11.pli: “cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā, terasa saṅghādisese ṭhapetvā, avasesāni khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadānī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.11.eng: “Apart from the four rules entailing expulsion and the thirteen rules entailing suspension, the rest are the minor training rules.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.13.pli: “cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā, terasa saṅghādisese ṭhapetvā, dve aniyate ṭhapetvā, avasesāni khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadānī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.13.eng: “Apart from the four rules entailing expulsion, the thirteen rules entailing suspension, and the two undetermined rules, the rest are the minor training rules.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.15.pli: “cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā, terasa saṅghādisese ṭhapetvā, dve aniyate ṭhapetvā, tiṃsa nissaggiye pācittiye ṭhapetvā, avasesāni khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadānī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.15.eng: “Apart from the four rules entailing expulsion, the thirteen rules entailing suspension, the two undetermined rules, and the thirty rules entailing relinquishment and confession, the rest are the minor training rules.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.17.pli: “cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā, terasa saṅghādisese ṭhapetvā, dve aniyate ṭhapetvā, tiṃsa nissaggiye pācittiye ṭhapetvā, dvenavuti pācittiye ṭhapetvā, avasesāni khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadānī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.17.eng: “Apart from the four rules entailing expulsion, the thirteen rules entailing suspension, the two undetermined rules, the thirty rules entailing relinquishment and confession, and the ninety-two rules entailing confession, the rest are the minor training rules.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.19.pli: “cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā, terasa saṅghādisese ṭhapetvā, dve aniyate ṭhapetvā, tiṃsa nissaggiye pācittiye ṭhapetvā, dvenavuti pācittiye ṭhapetvā, cattāro pāṭidesanīye ṭhapetvā, avasesāni khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadānī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.19.eng: “Apart from the four rules entailing expulsion, the thirteen rules entailing suspension, the two undetermined rules, the thirty rules entailing relinquishment and confession, the ninety-two rules entailing confession, and the four rules entailing acknowledgment, the rest are the minor training rules.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.20.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo saṅghaṃ ñāpesi—
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.20.eng: Then Venerable Mahākassapa informed the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.21.eng: “Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.22.eng: We have training rules that relate to householders.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.24.pli: ‘idaṃ vo samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.24.eng: what is allowable for us and what is not.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.25.pli: Sace mayaṃ khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadāni samūhanissāma, bhavissanti vattāro—
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.25.eng: If we abolish the minor training rules, some people will say,

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.26.eng: ‘The ascetic Gotama laid down training rules for his disciples until the time of his death.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.26.comm: For some reason dhūmakālika is not commented on in the Vipassana Research Institute’s version of Sp at https://www.tipitaka.org. The PTS version, however, comments as follows at Sp 5.1296: Dhūmakālikanti yāva samaṇassa (gotamassa) parinibbānacitakadhūmo paññāyati tāva kāloti, “Dhūmakālika means the time until the smoke from the final-extinguishment pyre of the ascetic Gotama.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.27.pli: Yāvimesaṃ satthā aṭṭhāsi tāvime sikkhāpadesu sikkhiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.27.eng: But they practice the training rules only as long as their teacher is alive.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.28.pli: Yato imesaṃ satthā parinibbuto, na dānime sikkhāpadesu sikkhantī’ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.28.eng: Since their teacher has now attained final extinguishment, they no longer practice them.’

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.29.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho apaññattaṃ nappaññapeyya, paññattaṃ na samucchindeyya, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vatteyya.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.29.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it shouldn’t lay down new rules, nor get rid of existing ones, and it should undertake to practice the training rules as they are.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.31.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.32.eng: We have training rules that relate to householders.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.34.pli: ‘idaṃ vo samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.34.eng: what is allowable for us and what is not.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.35.pli: Sace mayaṃ khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadāni samūhanissāma, bhavissanti vattāro—
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.35.eng: If we abolish the minor training rules, some people will say,

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.36.eng: ‘The ascetic Gotama laid down training rules for his disciples until the time of his death.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.37.pli: Yāvimesaṃ satthā aṭṭhāsi tāvime sikkhāpadesu sikkhiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.37.eng: But they practice the training rules only as long as their teacher is alive.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.38.pli: Yato imesaṃ satthā parinibbuto, na dānime sikkhāpadesu sikkhantī’ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.38.eng: Since their teacher has now attained final extinguishment, they no longer practice them.’

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.39.pli: Saṅgho apaññattaṃ nappaññapeti, paññattaṃ na samucchindati, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattati.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.39.eng: The Sangha doesn’t lay down new rules, nor get rid of existing ones, and it undertakes to practice the training rules as they are.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.40.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati apaññattassa appaññāpanā, paññattassa asamucchedo, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattanā, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.40.eng: Any monk who approves of not laying down new rules, nor of getting rid of existing ones, and of undertaking to practice the training rules as they are should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.41.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.42.pli: Saṅgho apaññattaṃ nappaññapeti, paññattaṃ na samucchindati, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattati.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.42.eng: The Sangha doesn’t lay down new rules, nor get rid of the existing ones, and it undertakes to practice the training rules as they are.

pli-tv-kd21:1.9.43.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.9.43.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.1.pli: Atha kho therā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.2.pli: “idaṃ te, āvuso ānanda, dukkaṭaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ bhagavantaṃ na pucchi—‘katamāni pana, bhante, khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadānī’ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.2.eng: “You have committed an act of wrong conduct, Ānanda, in that you didn’t ask the Buddha what the minor training rules are.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.4.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, bhante, assatiyā bhagavantaṃ na pucchiṃ—‘katamāni pana, bhante, khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadānī’ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.4.eng: “It was because of lack of mindfulness that I didn’t ask.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.5.pli: Nāhaṃ taṃ dukkaṭaṃ passāmi, api cāyasmantānaṃ saddhāya desemi taṃ dukkaṭan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.5.eng: I can’t see that I have committed any wrong conduct, but I’ll confess it out of faith in the venerables.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.6.pli: “Idampi te, āvuso ānanda, dukkaṭaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ bhagavato vassikasāṭikaṃ akkamitvā sibbesi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.6.eng: “You have also committed an act of wrong conduct in that you stepped on the Buddha’s rainy-season robe while you were sewing it.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.8.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, bhante, na agāravena bhagavato vassikasāṭikaṃ akkamitvā sibbesiṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.8.eng: “I didn’t step on it because of disrespect.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.9.pli: Nāhaṃ taṃ dukkaṭaṃ passāmi, api cāyasmantānaṃ saddhāya desemi taṃ dukkaṭan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.9.eng: I can’t see that I’ve committed any wrong conduct, but I’ll confess it out of faith in the venerables.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.10.pli: “Idampi te, āvuso ānanda, dukkaṭaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ mātugāmehi bhagavato sarīraṃ paṭhamaṃ vandāpesi, tāsaṃ rodantīnaṃ bhagavato sarīraṃ assukena makkhitaṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.10.eng: “You have also committed an act of wrong conduct in that you first had women pay respect to the Buddha’s dead body. They soiled the Buddha’s body with tears.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.12.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, bhante—māyimāsaṃ vikāle ahesunti—mātugāmehi bhagavato sarīraṃ paṭhamaṃ vandāpesiṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.12.eng: “I did this so that it wouldn’t get too late for them.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.13.pli: Nāhaṃ taṃ dukkaṭaṃ passāmi, api cāyasmantānaṃ saddhāya desemi taṃ dukkaṭan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.13.eng: I can’t see that I’ve committed any wrong conduct, but I’ll confess it out of faith in the venerables.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.14.pli: “Idampi te, āvuso ānanda, dukkaṭaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ bhagavatā oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne, oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne, na bhagavantaṃ yāci—
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.14.eng: “You have also committed an act of wrong conduct in that you didn’t ask the Buddha, even when he gave you a broad hint,

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.15.pli: ‘tiṭṭhatu bhagavā kappaṃ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṃ, bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.15.eng: to live on for an eon—for the benefit and happiness of humanity, out of compassion for the world, for the good, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.17.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, bhante, mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto na bhagavantaṃ yāciṃ—
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.17.eng: “I didn’t ask because my mind was possessed by the Lord of Death.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.18.pli: ‘tiṭṭhatu bhagavā kappaṃ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṃ, bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.19.pli: Nāhaṃ taṃ dukkaṭaṃ passāmi, api cāyasmantānaṃ saddhāya desemi taṃ dukkaṭan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.19.eng: I can’t see that I’ve committed any wrong conduct, but I’ll confess it out of faith in the venerables.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.20.pli: “Idampi te, āvuso ānanda, dukkaṭaṃ yaṃ tvaṃ mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye pabbajjaṃ ussukkaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.20.eng: “You have also committed an act of wrong conduct in that you made an effort for women to be given the going forth on the spiritual path proclaimed by the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.22.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, bhante, ayaṃ mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavato mātucchā āpādikā posikā khīrassa dāyikā bhagavantaṃ janettiyā kālaṅkatāya thaññaṃ pāyesīti mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye pabbajjaṃ ussukkaṃ akāsiṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.22.eng: “I made this effort because Mahāpajāpati Gotamī was the Buddha’s aunt who nurtured him, brought him up, and breastfed him when his own mother died.

pli-tv-kd21:1.10.23.pli: Nāhaṃ taṃ dukkaṭaṃ passāmi, api cāyasmantānaṃ saddhāya desemi taṃ dukkaṭan”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.10.23.eng: I can’t see that I’ve committed any wrong conduct, but I’ll confess it out of faith in the venerables.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.11.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā purāṇo dakkhiṇāgirismiṃ cārikaṃ carati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.11.1.eng: At that time Venerable Purāṇa was wandering in the Southern Hills with a large sangha of five hundred monks.

pli-tv-kd21:1.11.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā purāṇo therehi bhikkhūhi dhamme ca vinaye ca saṅgīte dakkhiṇāgirismiṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena rājagahaṃ yena veḷuvanaṃ kalandakanivāpo yena therā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā therehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammoditvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.11.2.eng: Soon the senior monks had concluded the communal recitation of the Teaching and the Monastic Law. Then, when Purāṇa had stayed in the Southern Hills for as long as he liked, he went to the Bamboo Grove at Rājagaha. There he went up to the senior monks, exchanged pleasantries with them, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd21:1.11.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ purāṇaṃ therā bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd21:1.11.4.pli: “therehi, āvuso purāṇa, dhammo ca vinayo ca saṅgīto.
pli-tv-kd21:1.11.4.eng: “Purāṇa, the senior monks have recited the Teaching and the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd21:1.11.6.eng: “The Teaching and the Monastic Law have been well-recited by the senior monks.

pli-tv-kd21:1.11.7.pli: Api ca yatheva mayā bhagavato sammukhā sutaṃ, sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, tathevāhaṃ dhāressāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.11.7.eng: Nevertheless, I’ll remember what I myself have received from the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando there bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd21:1.12.1.eng: Venerable Ānanda said to the senior monks,

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.2.eng: “At the time of his final extinguishment, the Buddha said to me,

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.3.pli: ‘tena hānanda, saṅgho mamaccayena channassa bhikkhuno brahmadaṇḍaṃ āṇāpetū’”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.12.3.eng: ‘After my passing away, Ānanda, the Sangha should impose the supreme penalty on the monk Channa.’”

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.8.pli: ‘Channo, ānanda, bhikkhu yaṃ iccheyya taṃ vadeyya.

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.9.pli: Bhikkhūhi channo bhikkhu neva vattabbo, na ovaditabbo, nānusāsitabbo’”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.12.9.eng: the monks shouldn’t correct him, instruct him, or teach him.’”

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.10.pli: “Tena hāvuso ānanda, tvaṃyeva channassa bhikkhuno brahmadaṇḍaṃ āṇāpehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.12.10.eng: “Well then, Ānanda, impose the supreme penalty on Channa.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.11.pli: “Kathāhaṃ, bhante, channassa bhikkhuno brahmadaṇḍaṃ āṇāpemi, caṇḍo so bhikkhu pharuso”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.12.11.eng: “But how should I do it? Channa is temperamental and harsh.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.12.pli: “Tena hāvuso ānanda, bahukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ gacchāhī”ti.

pli-tv-kd21:1.12.13.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭissutvā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi nāvāya ujjavanikāya kosambiṃ ujjavi, nāvāya paccorohitvā rañño udenassa uyyānassa avidūre aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.12.13.eng: Saying, “Yes, venerables,” he traveled by boat upstream to Kosambī with a large sangha of five hundred monks. After disembarking, he sat down at the foot of a tree not far from King Udena’s park.

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā udeno uyyāne paricāresi saddhiṃ orodhena.
pli-tv-kd21:1.13.1.eng: Just then King Udena was enjoying himself in the park together with his harem.

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.3.pli: “amhākaṃ kira ācariyo ayyo ānando uyyānassa avidūre aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinno”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.13.3.eng: that their teacher, Venerable Ānanda, was seated at the foot of a tree not far from the park.

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.4.pli: Atha kho rañño udenassa orodho rājānaṃ udenaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.5.pli: “amhākaṃ kira, deva, ācariyo ayyo ānando uyyānassa avidūre aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinno.

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.6.pli: Icchāma mayaṃ, deva, ayyaṃ ānandaṃ passitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.13.6.eng: adding, “Sir, we would like to see Venerable Ānanda.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.8.pli: Atha kho rañño udenassa orodho yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.13.8.eng: The harem women then went to Ānanda, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.9.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho rañño udenassa orodhaṃ āyasmā ānando dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.13.9.eng: And Ānanda instructed, inspired, and gladdened them with a teaching,

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.10.pli: Atha kho rañño udenassa orodho āyasmatā ānandena dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito āyasmato ānandassa pañca uttarāsaṅgasatāni pādāsi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.13.10.eng: at the end of which they gave him five hundred upper robes.

pli-tv-kd21:1.13.11.pli: Atha kho rañño udenassa orodho āyasmato ānandassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā yena rājā udeno tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd21:1.13.11.eng: After rejoicing and expressing their appreciation for his teaching, they got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated him with their right sides toward him, and went to King Udena.

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.1.pli: Addasā kho rājā udeno orodhaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.1.eng: When King Udena saw them coming,

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.3.pli: “api nu kho tumhe samaṇaṃ ānandaṃ passitthā”ti?

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.5.pli: “Api nu tumhe samaṇassa ānandassa kiñci adatthā”ti?

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.6.pli: “Adamhā kho mayaṃ, deva, ayyassa ānandassa pañca uttarāsaṅgasatānī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.6.eng: “We gave him five hundred upper robes.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.7.eng: King Udena complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇo ānando tāva bahuṃ cīvaraṃ paṭiggahessati.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.8.eng: “How can the ascetic Ānanda receive so many robes?

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.9.pli: Dussavāṇijjaṃ vā samaṇo ānando karissati, paggāhikasālaṃ vā pasāressatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.9.eng: Is he starting up as cloth merchant or setting up shop?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.10.pli: Atha kho rājā udeno yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṃ sammodi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.10.eng: King Udena then went to Ānanda, exchanged pleasantries with him,

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.11.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.12.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā udeno āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.13.pli: “āgamā nu khvidha, bho ānanda, amhākaṃ orodho”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.13.eng: “Sir Ānanda, did our harem women come here?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.16.eng: “They gave me five hundred upper robes.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.17.pli: “Kiṃ pana bhavaṃ ānando tāva bahuṃ cīvaraṃ karissatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.17.eng: “But what will you do with five hundred robes?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.18.pli: “Ye te, mahārāja, bhikkhū dubbalacīvarā tehi saddhiṃ saṃvibhajissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.18.eng: “I’ll share them with those monks whose robes are worn out.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.19.pli: “Yāni kho pana, bho ānanda, porāṇakāni dubbalacīvarāni tāni kathaṃ karissathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.19.eng: “And what will you do with the worn out robes?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.21.pli: “Yāni pana, bho ānanda, porāṇakāni uttarattharaṇāni tāni kathaṃ karissathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.21.eng: “And what will you do with the old bedspreads?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.23.pli: “Yā pana, bho ānanda, porāṇakā bhisicchaviyo tā kathaṃ karissathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.23.eng: “And what will you do with the old mattress covers?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.25.pli: “Yāni pana, bho ānanda, porāṇakāni bhūmattharaṇāni tāni kathaṃ karissathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.25.eng: “And what will you do with the old floor covers?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.27.pli: “Yā pana, bho ānanda, porāṇakā pādapuñchaniyo tā kathaṃ karissathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.27.eng: “And what will you do with the old doormats?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.29.pli: “Yāni pana, bho ānanda, porāṇakāni rajoharaṇāni tāni kathaṃ karissathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.29.eng: “And what will you do with the old dustcloths?”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.30.pli: “Tāni, mahārāja, koṭṭetvā cikkhallena madditvā paribhaṇḍaṃ limpissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.30.eng: “We’ll cut them up, mix them with mud, and smear the floors.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.31.pli: Atha kho rājā udeno—“sabbevime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā yoniso upanenti, na kulavaṃ gamentī”ti—
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.31.eng: King Udena thought, “These Sakyan monastics are clever at putting things to use; nothing is wasted,”
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.31.comm: “Nothing is wasted” renders na kulavaṁ gamenti. Sp-ṭ 4.445: Na kulavaṁ gamentīti niratthakavināsanaṁ na gamenti. Kucchito lavo kulavo, anayavināsoti vuttaṁ hoti, “Na kulavaṁ gamenti means they do not make it go to uselessness and ruin.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.32.pli: āyasmato ānandassa aññānipi pañca dussasatāni pādāsi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.32.eng: and he gave another five hundred pieces of cloth to Ānanda.

pli-tv-kd21:1.14.33.pli: Ayañcarahi āyasmato ānandassa paṭhamaṃ cīvarabhikkhā uppajji cīvarasahassaṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.14.33.eng: Together with the first offering of robes, Ānanda was given a total of one thousand robes.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena ghositārāmo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.1.eng: Ānanda then went to Ghosita’s Monastery where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā channo yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.2.eng: Venerable Channa went up to Ānanda, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ channaṃ āyasmā ānando etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.4.eng: “Channa, the Sangha has imposed the supreme penalty on you.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.6.pli: “Tvaṃ, āvuso channa, bhikkhū yaṃ iccheyyāsi taṃ vadeyyāsi.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.7.pli: Bhikkhūhi tvaṃ neva vattabbo, na ovaditabbo, nānusāsitabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.7.eng: the monks shouldn’t correct you, instruct you, or teach you.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.8.pli: “Nanvāhaṃ, bhante ānanda, hato ettāvatā, yatohaṃ bhikkhūhi neva vattabbo, na ovaditabbo, nānusāsitabbo”ti tattheva mucchito papato.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.8.eng: Exclaiming, “I’m ruined!” he fainted right there.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā channo brahmadaṇḍena aṭṭīyamāno harāyamāno jigucchamāno eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto nacirasseva—
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.9.eng: Being troubled, ashamed, and disgusted by the supreme penalty, Channa stayed by himself, secluded, heedful, energetic, and diligent.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.10.pli: yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṃ—
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.10.eng: And in this very life, he soon realized with his own insight the supreme goal of the spiritual life for which gentlemen rightly go forth into homelessness.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.11.pli: brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.12.pli: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.12.eng: He understood that birth had come to an end, that the spiritual life had been fulfilled, that the job had been done, that there was no further state of existence.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.13.pli: Aññataro ca panāyasmā channo arahataṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.13.eng: Venerable Channa became one of the perfected ones.

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā channo arahattaṃ patto yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.14.eng: He then went to Ānanda and said,

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.15.eng: “Venerable Ānanda, please lift the supreme penalty.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.15.16.pli: “Yadaggena tayā, āvuso channa, arahattaṃ sacchikataṃ tadaggena te brahmadaṇḍo paṭippassaddho”ti.
pli-tv-kd21:1.15.16.eng: “The supreme penalty was lifted the moment you realized perfection.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.1.pli: Imāya kho pana vinayasaṅgītiyā pañca bhikkhusatāni anūnāni anadhikāni ahesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd21:1.16.1.eng: At this communal recitation of the Monastic Law there were five hundred monks, neither more nor less.
pli-tv-kd21:1.16.1.comm: “Communal recitation of the Monastic Law” renders vinayasaṅgīti. The meaning of this compound seems straightforward, but Sp-ṭ 4.445 interprets it as follows: “Dhammavinayasaṅgītiyā”ti vattabbe saṅgītiyā vinayappadhānattā “vinayasaṅgītiyā”ti vuttaṁ, “When ‘communal recitation of the Teaching and the Monastic Law’ should be said, ‘vinayasaṅgīti’ is said instead, because of the striving according to the Monastic Law at the communal recitation.” This explanation seems contrived. Indeed, the second saṅgīti is also called a vinayasaṅgīti, except that in this case the meaning “Communal recitation of the Monastic Law” fits well. It seems likely to me that this compound should mean the same in the two contexts that are so similar. Might it then be that the first communal recitation was limited to reciting the Monastic Law?

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.2.eng: This is why this communal recitation is called “The group of five hundred”.

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.3.pli: Pañcasatikakkhandhako ekādasamo. Imamhi khandhake vatthū tevīsati.
pli-tv-kd21:1.16.3.eng: The eleventh chapter on the group of five hundred is finished. In this chapter there are twenty-three topics.

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.11.eng: We will recite the true Teaching,

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.12.eng: Before what is contrary to the Teaching shines forth.

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.15.eng: Communal recitation of the Teaching and the Monastic Law,

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.16.eng: Staying in the best of caves.

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.17.eng: He asked Upāli about the Monastic Law,

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.18.eng: And the wise Ānanda about the discourses;

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.19.eng: Communal recitation of the three Collections,

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.20.eng: Was done by the disciples of the Victor.

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.23.eng: He did not ask, having stepped on,

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.24.eng: Had pay respect, and did not ask.

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.26.eng: Wrong conduct for me out of faith;

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.34.eng: With the first, the one called Ānanda;

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.38.eng: Therefore it was ‘the group of five hundred’.”

pli-tv-kd21:1.16.39.eng: The chapter on the group of five hundred is finished.
